intro: Triplarina imbricata, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in coastal areas. Triplarina imbricata is a low-growing plant with a compact habit, making it well-suited for rocky habitats.
